subject: Negotiation
title: Yes Doesn't Always Mean Yes
description: Learn Yes Doesn't Always Mean Yes in one minute.

hook.text: Your counterpart said 'yes' three times â€” and still didn't agree to anything.

buildup.text: In many cultures, 'yes' means 'I hear you' or 'I understand' â€” not 'I agree.'

discovery.text: In Southeast Asia and parts of Africa, saying 'no' directly is considered rude and confrontational.

twist.text: Treating every 'yes' as agreement leads to deals that unravel when implementation begins.

climax.text: Confirm understanding by asking specific follow-up questions, not just 'Do you agree?'

punchline.text: When 'yes' can mean 'no,' ask better questions.
